Name: novel_idea_generation_methods
Title: Novel Idea Generation Methods: Developing and comparing different idea generation methods for automated research paper generation.
Method: We propose a new idea generation method that combines the strengths of different existing methods and improves their weaknesses.
Experiment: In this experiment, we compare the performance of different idea generation methods (perform_generate_idea()) on automated research paper generation performance. We use the review score by (perform_review()) as the evaluation metric.

Name: adaptive_idea_refinement
Title: Adaptive Idea Refinement: A Self-Improving Meta-Learning Approach for Automated Research Idea Generation
Method: We propose an Adaptive Idea Refinement (AIR) method that uses feedback from the review process to continuously improve the quality of generated research ideas. This self-improving system creates a memory bank of past ideas and reviews, analyzes review feedback, and adapts the idea generation process based on learned patterns of successful ideas. AIR uniquely applies meta-learning principles to the domain of research idea generation.
Experiment: Modify the generate_ideas() function to incorporate the AIR method: 1) Create a data structure to store past ideas and their reviews. 2) Implement an analysis function to extract insights from reviews. 3) Modify the idea generation process to use these insights. Run multiple iterations of the entire process (idea generation, paper writing, review) and compare the quality of ideas and resulting papers over time. Include a parallel run with a non-adaptive baseline method for comparison. Monitor computational resources used for storage and analysis.

Name: idea_fusion_evolution
Title: Idea Fusion and Evolution: A Genetic Algorithm Approach to Research Idea Generation with Dynamic Fitness Evaluation
Method: We propose the Idea Fusion and Evolution (IFE) method, which applies principles from genetic algorithms to research idea generation. IFE generates a pool of initial ideas, analyzes their components, creates 'offspring' ideas by combining elements from different 'parent' ideas, applies mutations, and selects promising ideas for the next generation. IFE incorporates a dynamic fitness evaluation system that considers multiple factors including novelty, feasibility, and potential impact. To maintain diversity, it employs techniques like niching and adaptive mutation rates.
Experiment: Modify the generate_ideas() function to implement IFE: 1) Generate an initial idea pool. 2) Implement functions for idea component analysis, idea combination, and mutation. 3) Create a multi-factor fitness evaluation system using existing idea ratings and additional metrics like idea diversity. 4) Implement diversity preservation mechanisms. 5) Run multiple generations of idea evolution, monitoring computational resources. 6) Compare IFE's output quality, diversity, and efficiency with the standard method and a simple genetic algorithm baseline. Metrics should include individual idea ratings, population diversity measures, and improvement rates across generations.

Name: focused_interdisciplinary_idea_synthesis
Title: Focused Interdisciplinary Idea Synthesis: Generating Novel AI Research Ideas Through Controlled Cross-Domain Integration
Method: We propose the Focused Interdisciplinary Idea Synthesis (FIIS) method for AI research idea generation. FIIS creates a curated knowledge base of concepts and methodologies from pre-defined AI-relevant domains, uses existing idea evaluation metrics to develop a similarity measure for cross-domain concept matching, and generates research ideas by applying techniques from one domain to problems in another.
Experiment: 1. Modify generate_ideas() to implement FIIS: a) Create a function to build a knowledge base of concepts from pre-defined AI-relevant domains. b) Implement a similarity metric using existing idea evaluation criteria. c) Develop an algorithm to combine concepts and generate interdisciplinary research ideas. 2. Compare FIIS-generated ideas with those from previous methods using quantitative metrics: novelty, potential impact, feasibility, and the number of distinct domains referenced. 3. Analyze the uniqueness of domain combinations in generated ideas. 4. Evaluate the computational efficiency of FIIS compared to previous methods.

Name: adaptive_trend_aware_contrastive_idea_generation
Title: Adaptive Trend-Aware Contrastive Idea Generation: Self-Improving AI Research Ideation
Method: We propose Adaptive Trend-Aware Contrastive Idea Generation (ATACIG), a method that uses historical idea ratings as a proxy for research trends. ATACIG creates a 'trend vector' based on characteristics of highly-rated past ideas, then uses contrastive learning techniques to generate new ideas that are distinct from but related to this trend. This approach balances novelty with relevance and incorporates a self-improving mechanism.
Experiment: 1. Modify generate_ideas() to implement ATACIG: a) Create a function to analyze past idea ratings and construct a trend vector. b) Implement a contrastive learning algorithm to generate ideas distinct from but related to the trend vector. c) Develop a mechanism to identify potential gaps based on low-rated areas. d) Create a scoring system that balances novelty, trend-alignment, and potential impact. 2. Run multiple iterations of the idea generation process, allowing ATACIG to learn and adapt over time. 3. Compare ATACIG-generated ideas with those from previous methods using metrics like novelty, trend-alignment, and improvement over iterations. 4. Analyze the distribution of generated ideas and their alignment with identified gaps. 5. Evaluate the computational efficiency and how it changes over iterations.

Name: blind_spot_detection_mitigation
Title: Blind Spot Detection and Mitigation: Enhancing AI Research Idea Generation through Self-Analysis and Targeted Exploration
Method: We propose the Blind Spot Detection and Mitigation (BSDM) method for improving AI research idea generation. BSDM implements a self-analysis mechanism to identify potential blind spots in the AI's knowledge and idea generation patterns. It then develops targeted exploration strategies to gather information and generate ideas in these blind spot areas, integrating the newly gained insights into the existing idea generation process.
Experiment: 1. Implement BSDM in generate_ideas(): a) Develop a self-analysis function to identify patterns and potential blind spots. b) Create a targeted exploration mechanism for blind spots. c) Integrate new insights into idea generation. 2. Run multiple iterations, allowing BSDM to address blind spots over time. 3. Compare BSDM ideas with previous methods using novelty, diversity, and research area coverage metrics. 4. Analyze the evolution of identified blind spots and idea generation in underexplored areas. 5. Evaluate BSDM's impact on overall idea quality and originality.
